Subjective: Left ear pain and feeling of fullness, like water inside, for 2-3 days. Gradually worsening. Associated decreased hearing in left ear. Pain is 3-4/10, increasing to 6-7/10 after showering. Pain is manageable. Aggravated by swimming and showering. Unable to swim due to pain. Started swimming a few weeks ago. Cleans ears with cotton buds 3x/week. No fever, feels systemically well. No painkillers taken. Request: Wants ear examined, pain relief, and improved hearing. Concerned about hearing.
Objective: Vitals: Temp 36.2 C. Physical Exam: Right Ear: Canal clean, tympanic membrane normal. Left Ear: Pain on pinna pull. External auditory canal is red, swollen, and inflamed. Tympanic membrane not well visualized.
Assessment: Left Otitis Externa (inflammation of the ear canal).
Plan: 1. Paracetamol up to 4000mg daily as needed for pain. 2. Acidic, anti-inflammatory ear drops, three times a day for one week. 3. Advice: Keep left ear dry for one week. Stop cleaning ear with cotton buds. 4. Follow-up: Return for consultation in one week.
